1. You can over-crew Vehicles Unidentified Hovership Market Price: $0.31

Defiant Survivor Market Price: $0.07

It's important to remember that you can over-crew Vehicles, i.e., tap more than one creature even if a single one already has enough power to crew it. You can tap your entire team of Survivors this way. For example, if you control multiple copies of Defiant Survivor, then all of them can jump into Unidentified Hovership, allowing you to trigger all of their manifest dread abilities.

You can even use an animated Vehicle to crew another. After a rules update in 2022, animated Vehicles can no longer crew themselves, but they can still crew other Vehicles. This could come up if you somehow have two copies of Unidentified Hovership while controlling The Wandering Rescuer. If your opponent tries to remove one of them, tap it to crew the other so that it gains hexproof and emerges unscathed.

  1. Give opponents a toothache Fear of Lost Teeth Market Price: $0.04

Flesh Burrower Market Price: $0.02

In a green-black deck, Fear of Lost Teeth is one of the best targets for Flesh Burrower's deathtouch ability. If the opponent were to block the 1/1, then both creatures would typically die, triggering Fear of Lost Teeth's ping effect. SInce it had deathtouch as it died, the damage from the triggered ability would also have deathtouch, allowing you to take down a second creature. As the opponent will almost never want to let that happen, Flesh Burrower can make Fear of Lost Teeth practically unblockable.

  1. Dissect your entire board Dissection Tools Market Price: $0.12

Popular Egotist Market Price: $0.07

The black-red archetype in Duskmourn Limited is all about sacrifice. For example, there is the classic steal-and-sac combos between Vengeful Possession and Final Vengeance. You can similarly net a lot of value by sacrificing Disturbing Mirth to Betrayer's Bargain. But the ultimate dream is to dissect your entire board.

The two-card combo of Dissection Tools and Popular Egotist allows you to drain your opponent for each creature you control. As Dissection Tools is a free sacrifice outlet, you can sacrifice each equipped creature to move it elsewhere, triggering Popular Egotist. With the equip ability, you can even sacrifice Popular Egotist as the last creature remaining, targeting itself. If you enjoyed Mayhem Devil math for Rakdos Sacrifice decks in Constructed formats, then this may bring back good memories.

  1. An entire Suite for an Oculus Surgical Suite // Hospital Room Market Price: $0.14

Abhorrent Oculus Market Price: $30.63

Abhorrent Oculus is a huge bomb, but its cost can be steep. Usually, it isn't until the end game before you have six cards in your graveyard. Surgical Suite circumvents this, allowing you to put Abhorrent Oculus on the battlefield as early as turn three. Just discard the creature to Splitskin Doll, then return it with the enchantment.

Other cheap creatures that are detrimental to cast include Patched Plaything and Fear of Exposure. Surgical Suite is a great way to bypass their downsides.

  1. The flying Gremlins Toby, Beastie Befriender Market Price: $0.47

Midnight Mayhem Market Price: $0.04

This one-two punch is a strong one to look out for. You lead with Toby, Beastie Befriender on turn three, creating a 4/4 Beast. Then on turn four, you cast Midnight Mayhem, and all of a sudden you control four creature tokens in total. This means that Toby gives all of them flying. Those Gremlins are already a menace, but as fliers they will dominate the damage race even more.

While we're setting up dream curves, we can also add Lionheart Glimmer on turn five to boost all of the tokens. It's not necessary, but it'll lock up the game for sure.

  1. Counter your own spell to keep up the pressure Fear of Impostors Market Price: $0.14

Unable to Scream Market Price: $0.07

Fear of Impostors is a versatile card. If you use its counter ability on an opponent's spell, then it basically turns into a Cancel, as the opponent can typically trade the manifested creature for your 3/2. Sometimes, however, you just need some pressure, especially if the opponent stumbles and you hold more than enough removal spells. In these situations, you should remember that you can also target your own spells.

For example, you can cast Unable to Scream on any creature, hold priority and counter it so you get to manifest dread instead. If you try to do that online, make sure to hold Control.

  1. Build an enormous swarm of Insects Broodspinner Market Price: $0.09

Marvin, Murderous Mimic Market Price: $1.85

There are various creatures in the format with activated abilities for Marvin, Murderous Mimic to steal, but the best one might be Broodspinner. In a dedicated delirium deck, its activated ability can easily create four or more 1/1 fliers. That by itself might not be enough to win the game, but a second activation will surely get the job done. Otherwise, add The Swarmweaver to beef up the swarm.

The best part is that if you sacrifice Marvin to create Insects, then it counts itself as an artifact. That extra card type could make a big difference.
